citeinfo.origin: National Fisheries Research and Development Institute (NFRDI)
citeinfo.title: 1978-1988 Korean Bering Sea Commercial Groundfish Database

descript.abstract: Korea conducted commercial demersal bottom trawl operations for yellowfin sole and pelagic trawl operations for walleye Pollock in the in the Bering Sea. Data recorded included water temperature, depth of fishing gear, towing time (hours), CPUE (tons/hour) and catch (tons). Biological samples of the catch included length frequency, sex ratio, and otolith samples for age determination. Data were recorded on log sheets. Some of the log sheets have been keypunched.
descript.purpose: Purpose The purpose of database was to archive biological information on the exploited stock and to record their distribution.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
